   Typo? `#ifndef` -> `#ifdef`?
   See test failure on macos from a recent pr
   https://github.com/apache/arrow/runs/5818260165?check_suite_focus=true#step:8:420

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

comments.body: FWIW seems to have happened again here [https://github.com/apache/arrow/runs/5679667177?check_suite_focus=true]
Thanks.  I'll look at this one today.

I tried running this test on Linux & Windows in many different configurations without much luck.

Both failures are on MacOS so I worked on getting a MacOS environment to reproduce.  I was able to reproduce a deadlock on MacOS.  The failure occurred in TestThreadPoolForkSafety.NestedChild in the call to waitpid.  That was as far as I got debugging.  I'll look into this more tomorrow now that I can reproduce.

Ok, after testing this for a while, I think that the NestedChild test is not technically safe.  On the man page for {{fork}} we see:

{noformat}
After a fork() in a multithreaded program, the child can
          safely call only async-signal-safe functions (see
          signal-safety(7)) until such time as it calls execve(2).
{noformat}

It seems we get away with this on Linux.  Also, it seems that tests like MultipleChildThreads works fine even though it also seems unsafe.

For whatever reason it seems that a grandchild fork is simply not really supported on osx.  The grandchild process never finishes.  Instead it gets stuck in bizarre and nonsensical deadlocks (backtrace of one such deadlock attached.  There are only two threads and they are blocked on unrelated mutexes). [^stacktrace.txt]
